cardregister

Class Register

  • java.lang.Object
    • cardregister.Register
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardRegister

    public class Register
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardRegister
    An implementation of CardRegister. This class both contains all the cards in the register, and provides the basic functionality to operate with them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Register()
      The sole constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • createCard

        public void createCard(java.lang.String[] content)
                throws CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException,
                       CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException,
                       CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException
        Creates a new Card to the register.
        Specified by:
        createCard in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        content - The text fields of the card to be created
        Throws:
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException - if no text field has content.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException - if there already is a card which is almost the same by the standards of
        CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException - Never.
        CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException
        CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException
        See Also:
        method.

      • deleteCards

        public void deleteCards(java.lang.String[][] toBeDeleted)
        For deleting cards from the register.
        Specified by:
        deleteCards in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        toBeDeleted - The content of the cards which are being deleted. First argument specifies the card and the second it's fields. Thus, when deleting two cards both having five fields the argument would be of form String[2][5]. Deleting cards will set needsSave true.

      • editCard

        public void editCard(java.lang.String[] cardData,
            java.lang.String[] newData)
              throws CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException,
                     CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException
        Edits data of an already existing card.
        Specified by:
        editCard in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        oldData - the data of the card which is being edited. This is used to specify the card.
        newData - the data of the card once it is edited.
        Throws:
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException - if all the fields are empty.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException - if the card is sufficiently similar to an already existing card other than the one being edited. The similarity is decided by the searchRelativelySimilarCardsData-method, and thus relies ultimately on the isRelativelyEqualTo-method of * the Card-class.
        Control.CardRegisterExceptions.CardAlreadyExistsException - Never.
        CardRegisterExceptions.AlmostSameCardExistsException
        CardRegisterExceptions.NullInputException

      • getCardData

        public java.lang.String[][] getCardData()
        Retrieves card data. All the contents of the cards in the register will be returned as a string array, whose first dimension is the same as the number of the cards and the second is the number of text fields in a card. Thus, for 20 cards having 7 text field the returned array would be String[20][7].
        Specified by:
        getCardData in interface CardRegister
        Returns:
        The content of the cards.

      • getCurrentFile

        public java.io.File getCurrentFile()
        Tells which file the register is attached to. This is the file the register was last saved to or loaded from.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentFile in interface CardRegister
        Returns:
        the file attached to this register.

      • getFieldNames

        public java.lang.String[] getFieldNames()
        Returns what are the labels of the text fields in a card. For example in a register of race horses, the labels could be {"Name", "Owner", "Fastest run"...}. These labels correspond in order all the data sent in and out the cardRegister. Thus it is safe to couple them with the retrieved data like this: fieldNames[0] ~ data[0][0], fieldNames[1] ~ data[0][1], fieldNames[2] ~ data[0][2],...
        Specified by:
        getFieldNames in interface CardRegister
        Returns:
        the labels as an array of Strings.

      • getNameField

        public int getNameField()
        Tells which text field is the name of the whole card. I.e. for race horses it would be natural to select the title of the card to be the horse's name. This methods tells what field contains the name of the horse.
        Specified by:
        getNameField in interface CardRegister
        Returns:
        The name field's number.

      • load

        public void load(java.io.File file)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads the card data from the specified file. About the format of the file, check specifications from the package CardStrorage.
        Specified by:
        load in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        file - The file from which the data is read.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the specified file does not exist.

      • needsToBeSaved

        public boolean needsToBeSaved()
        Tells whether information is lost when the file is closed without saving. This can be used to warn the user before he closes the program or tries to load a new file. The register is considered changed after adding, deleting or editing a card. Successful load, save or reset will set this false again.
        Specified by:
        needsToBeSaved in interface CardRegister
        Returns:
        true if the register has changed since the last save, false otherwise.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Empties the register.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface CardRegister

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the register to the file set as current. When using this method it's advised to check that there really is a current file to save on.
        Specified by:
        save in interface CardRegister
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the save fails.

      • search

        public java.lang.String[][] search(java.lang.String[] search)
        Used for detailed search of the register.
        Specified by:
        search in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        searchWords - The search words as an array of strings. Each string corresponds to a text field in a card. Whether or not card is included in the search is decided by the fieldsInclude-method of the Card-class.
        Returns:
        The contents of the cards satisfying the search. The first argument indicated the card and the second it's field's number.

      • searchAnyField

        public java.lang.String[][] searchAnyField(java.lang.String searchWord)
        Searches the search word from any field of the cards. The result includes all the cards for which the method searchAnyField returns true.
        Specified by:
        searchAnyField in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        searchWord - The word to be searched.
        Returns:
        The contents of the cards satisfying the search. The first argument indicated the card and the second it's field's number.

      • setCurrentFile

        public void setCurrentFile(java.io.File file)
        Sets the register attached to the file for saving etc.
        Specified by:
        setCurrentFile in interface CardRegister
        Parameters:
        file - The file register will be attached to.
